programmes.show_description: Newcastle accordion and drums duo ATFK aka Amy Thatcher and Francesca Knowles choose an hour of music where acoustic meets electronic.
Recorded in Los Angeles Ralph Johnson's selection of the finest Jazz from the 60's & 70's.
Featuring selections from Miles Davis, Freddie Hubbard, Oliver Nelson and Shirley Horn.
It's back to 1990 and King George's Hall in Blackburn for an early Charlatans gig, and there are BBC sessions from Pink Kross and The Mauskovic Dance Band.
Soundtrack the early hours with back to back music, plus exclusive BBC sessions.
Chris Hawkins fires up Thursday with the biggest tunes and future classics.
DJ, producer and artist Honey Dijon chats to Nick and shares her new music.
Lauren's got the finest music to motivate your Thursday, with the best tunes old and new.
Comedian and writer Lucy Beaumont joins Craig to chat about her upcoming tour 'Bad At Quiz Shows, Good With Weirdos'.
Huw has handpicked music, old and new, plus we round up the gigs, shows and festivals that everybody is talking about in today's Gig Lisztomania.
Chilli Jesson from Dead Dads Club, DJ and producer Anish Kumar and presenter Tara Kumar join Huw on his weekly Roundtable to review the latest music releases.
Start your weekend early with a mix from KAVARI, who is also this week's Breaking Artist, known for her genre defying, hard hitting productions.
Gideon Coe with his music loves from every era and genre.
4/4. 6 Music Festival 2026 headliners The Horrors share some of their favourite new artists.
Get your fix of all the best new releases in one handy playlist.
Damon Albarn and Jamie Hewlett talk new Gorillaz, and Bill Callahan and Lala Lala breakdown their new albums. Plus Matt Everitt picks some tracks from Mitski and Tony Bontana.
6 Music takes you through the early hours playing back to back music.
6 Music goes back to the 90s!
6 Music goes back to the 00s!
Chris Hawkins takes you through 30 minutes of remixed, re-versioned and reimagined tracks.
New music and the biggest Friday bangers with Chris Hawkins.
Actor Amanda Seyfried joins Nick to talk about her latest film, The Testament of Ann Lee, and her collaboration with composer Daniel Blumberg.
Lauren brings a great selection of tunes to kick-start your weekend.
Craig spins some joyous tunes to get your weekend started, before opening up the Trunk of Funk!
It's Friday, so Huw is out to prove that any song sounds better when it's played on 6 Music by Huw Stephens - so let us know what you want to hear.

programmes.show_name: The People's Party with Femi Koleoso
programmes.show_description: The renowned UK Garage DJ and Producer paints a bright picture of his ideal Friday night in and night out, and shares an iconic Friday he's had recently.
Nothing but solid gold upbeat indie bangers; a throwback to the indie tunes you love with a sprinkling of the finest future hits.
An hour of British Indie hits from Anna Calvi, Franz Ferdinand, Wet Leg and Foals!

programmes.show_name: The 6 Mix with Mary Anne Hobbs
programmes.show_description: Chloe Robinson is b2b with her friend and collaborator Paleman for the 6 Mix ahead of their new cookie cutter/tiger EP released on her own label Pretty Weird.
